sentences.sContent: I think London was a good choice as a venue.
sentences.sCn: 我觉得伦敦是个很好的选址。

sentences.sContent: ...Some believe that it is a better choice to study in domestic colleges...
...Some believe that it is a better choice to dig into the humanities...
...Without the choice to pursue overseas study...
...I totally agree with the former choice for the reasons presented below...
...Some believe that it is a better choice to acquire knowledge in science...
...You should decide on the best choice and mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 2 with a single line through the centre...
...there has been a heated discussion as to a better choice between attending college at home and abroad...
...there has been a heated discussion as to the best choice in selecting the major...
...and which choice would we want our robotic counterparts to make...
...the robots decision and its calculated approach raise an important question:would humans make the same choice and which choice would we want our robotic counterparts to make...

phrases.pCn: v. 没有选择的余地；不特别偏爱哪一个
可以挑选，有选择的自由，有选择权
可供选择的品种不多，没什么可供选择的

trans.tranOther: the person or thing that someone chooses
(especially of food) of very good quality
